title: Ticket #5696: add knob to allow CCB reconnections from any ip address
description:
When a daemon contacts a CCB server and requests a listen port, the CCB server returns a CCB ID and a cookie (capability string) to the daemon. In the event that TCP socket to the CCB server is closed, the daemon can send a reconnect request to the CCB server in order to keep the same CCB ID. The reconnect request must contain a copy of the cookie that was generated by the server during the original request, and also originate from the same IP address.

To help facilitate the placement of HTCondor daemons inside of virtual machines that hibernate and subsequently restart with a different public IP address (think CMS@Home type volunteer computing, where the execute node may be a laptop that moves from a work network to a home network), we want a patch to relax the CCB server requirement that the reconnect request must come from the same public IP.

Propose a patch to introduce CCB server knob CCB_RECONNECT_ALLOWED_FROM_ANY_IP, which defaults to false. If true, then the reconnect request can come from any IP address that can still produce the cookie.

At this point, we do not want to document this knob, because it may go away; at this point we want it just for testing purposes. Ideally, eventually each individual CCB connection will be able to state if a reconnect is allowed from a different address instead of a single knob that impacts them all.
